page.title: 11Godwin's Peat Works (1)
page.content:
The peat has to go through five processes before it is sold to the customer. They are{cutting, grinding, {sterilising,}the addition of{lime}and {fertiliser}and finally bagging.
{1. THE CUTTING OF THE PEAT.} A machine cuts a slice of peat from the ground. One side of the slice is cut off and comes out of a chute. The peat inside the machine gets cut into nine blocks and gets stacked into a neat line. The peat that is in the pile gets moved into another pile so that the blocks on the bottom can dry. When the peat is dry it is taken to the peat works. When the peat dries it gets lighter in both colour and weight. {2. GRINDING } Before the peat can be used it has to be ground up into small pieces.
